questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'She ___ (go) to school every day.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present simple. 'She goes to school every day.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'They ___ (play) football yesterday.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is past simple. 'They played football yesterday.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'I ___ (read) a book now.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present continuous. 'I am reading a book now.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'We ___ (visit) the museum tomorrow.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is future simple. 'We will visit the museum tomorrow.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'He ___ (finish) his homework already.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present perfect. 'He has finished his homework already.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'They ___ (live) in this city for five years.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present perfect. 'They have lived in this city for five years.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'She ___ (cook) dinner when I arrived.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is past continuous. 'She was cooking dinner when I arrived.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'I ___ (see) him last week.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is past simple. 'I saw him last week.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'We ___ (go) to the park every Sunday.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present simple. 'We go to the park every Sunday.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'She ___ (write) a letter now.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present continuous. 'She is writing a letter now.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'They ___ (finish) their work by tomorrow.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is future simple. 'They will finish their work by tomorrow.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'He ___ (study) for the exam for two hours.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present perfect continuous. 'He has been studying for the exam for two hours.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'I ___ (eat) breakfast before I left.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is past simple. 'I ate breakfast before I left.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'We ___ (watch) TV when it started to rain.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is past continuous. 'We were watching TV when it started to rain.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'She ___ (finish) her homework by the time I arrived.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is past perfect. 'She had finished her homework by the time I arrived.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'They ___ (play) football every Saturday.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present simple. 'They play football every Saturday.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'I ___ (read) a book when you called.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is past continuous. 'I was reading a book when you called.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'She ___ (visit) her grandparents next week.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is future simple. 'She will visit her grandparents next week.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'They ___ (live) here since 2010.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present perfect. 'They have lived here since 2010.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'He ___ (work) on the project for three hours.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present perfect continuous. 'He has been working on the project for three hours.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'I ___ (see) him yesterday.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is past simple. 'I saw him yesterday.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'We ___ (go) to the beach every summer.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present simple. 'We go to the beach every summer.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'She ___ (write) a letter when I saw her.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is past continuous. 'She was writing a letter when I saw her.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'They ___ (finish) their work by the end of the day.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is future simple. 'They will finish their work by the end of the day.'

questions.question: Choose the correct tense: 'He ___ (study) for the exam for three hours.'
questions.explanation: The correct tense is present perfect continuous. 'He has been studying for the exam for three hours.'
